image.altText: Two Indigenous women smile at the camera in a composite image that includes a black and white photo and red desert.

props.synopsis: It has been more than 40 years since the Pintupi Nine made contact with the modern world. Much has changed in their lives, but their country has never stopped calling them home.

title.children: For years, these sisters didn't know white people existed

image.altText: An Aboriginal young woman, with black hair and a red stripe, holding a paint brush while dying someone's hair.

props.synopsis: Whether it's a fade, mullet or colours, a mobile salon set up in a shipping container out bush is giving Indigenous students access to haircuts and the opportunity to learn the trade.

title.children: 'People are thrilled': New remote salon ends hours-long trip for a cut

image.altText: NT Police Commissioner Michael Murphy speaking into a microphone in front of a crowd and looking emotional.

props.synopsis: Michael Murphy had planned to deliver a second apology to Aboriginal people in the remote Northern Territory. But after his sudden departure, there’s no certainty it will happen.

title.children: Unfinished business: NT top cop's departure leaves second apology unsaid

image.altText: Justice Blokland in robes on the bench

props.synopsis: Presiding over the worst categories of offending in the NT Supreme Court, Judge Jenny Blokland is afforded a unique view of how justice is served. Her estimates are sobering.

title.children: Judge urges radical rethink of NT's 'wicked problem'

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman standing among a group of colourful graves with mosaic headstones.

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal community in far west New South Wales works through grief for lost loved ones with a hands-on project using the art of mosaic.

title.children: 'Represents how broken you feel': Mosaic headstones help people with grief

image.altText: A shadowed figure behind a fence

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's prison population has reached a new high following its largest quarterly increase on record, cementing it as Australia's most incarcerated jurisdiction.

title.children: If the NT was a nation, its prison rate would trail only El Salvador

image.altText: Scabies mite magnified.

props.synopsis: A new tool to test for scabies is being trialled by doctors in the Northern Territory, with researchers hoping early diagnosis could prevent people with the skin infestation from developing other life-threatening illnesses.

title.children: From housemates to remote communities, scabies 'can happen to anyone'

image.altText: Chinese flag with cattle

props.synopsis: Hundreds of abattoirs in the United States are at risk of being banned from exporting meat to China, because their export licences are due to expire this weekend.

title.children: US meat trade days away from getting 'kicked out' of China

image.altText: Steven Spurrier (right) holds up a wine glass with red wine it.

props.synopsis: Almost 50 years ago, American wine faced its first David vs Goliath moment against Europe. Now the pair are bracing for their next big battle.

title.children: Europe and the US are in the midst of a wine war. It's not their first

image.altText: Darcy Fogarty and Isaac Cumming celebrate a goal.

props.synopsis: Adelaide has wasted little time before putting St Kilda to the sword as the two sides open their AFL season with a clash at the Adelaide Oval. Follow live.

title.children: Crows threaten to run up massive margin against struggling Saints

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Saints strike as Wanganeen-Milera comes off
Debut time for Sid Draper as Crows activate sub

image.altText: President Donald Trump speaks on the phone with Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull.

props.synopsis: When a malignant force bears down on the country, Australians have shown a tendency to swing behind the leader.

title.children: Trump's message to Australia redefines 'mateship' as true allies re-emerge

image.altText: Donald Trump's tie is blown by the wind as he descends the stairs from Air Force One.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump had invoked the Alien Enemies Act of 1798, a sweeping wartime authority that would have allowed him broader leeway to speed up mass deportations, on the basis that the US was being "invaded" by a Venezuelan gang.

title.children: Trump's use of 18th-century law to speed up deportations blocked by judge

props.synopsis: Trade wars, strongmen, and economic chaos. The world has seen this before.

title.children: Trade wars, strongmen, and economic chaos at a critical time for Australia

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: a man in a black suit and red tie punches through a blue swirl

props.synopsis: Checking facts is as old as journalism and Donald Trump's political rise has underscored its value. So why have media organisations like Meta changed tack?

title.children: Free expression or 'fake news': media's fight for truth

image.altText: An emotional Maximo Napa standing alongside his son and a female military officer speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: Peruvian fisherman Maximo Napa Castro has been rescued in the Pacific Ocean after first setting off for a two-week fishing trip and ending up missing and adrift for 95 days.

title.children: Man missing at sea for months survived by 'eating roaches, birds, turtles'

image.altText: GettyImages-2205309049

props.synopsis: McLaren is starting at the front, Lewis Hamilton is making his Ferrari debut, and rain has caused chaos already at the Australian Grand Prix. Follow live.

title.children: Piastri looks to make history as the Australian Grand Prix starts in wild weather

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Rookie into the wall on the formation lap. Hadjar is OUT
All drivers on intermediate tyres, except Lance Stroll
Liam Lawson to start from pit lane

props.synopsis: We asked Mark Mattson, an American neuroscientist who has studied intermittent fasting for the last 25 years, about what goes inside our body when we are fasting.

title.children: How fasting can switch on the body's cell recycling system

image.altText: A man with strawberry blonde hair looks at the camera with a serious face.

props.synopsis: Two years ago, former NBL player Harry Froling was laying in a hospital bed fighting for his life. Now he's set on coming back better than ever.

title.children: After a sickening one-punch attack, Harry Froling was told he'd never play basketball again

image.altText: A couple with their premature baby

props.synopsis: As Tropical Cyclone Alfred neared the Queensland coast, toppling trees and downing powerlines, more than 2000 health workers in the state's south bunkered down in hospitals to ensure patients were well cared for.

title.children: Mum reunites with premature baby after Cyclone Alfred forced them apart

image.altText: A group of Yemeni men and boys hold up rifles in protest as they shout slogans.

props.synopsis: The strikes are the first to hit Yemen since the Gaza ceasefire deal took effect in January, and signal a more aggressive approach from the US, which has previously limited its actions to degrading the Houthis' ability to carry out missile and drone attacks.

title.children: Trump orders strikes on Yemen's capital over attacks on Red Sea shipping

image.altText: Two boats can be seen searching along the river.

props.synopsis: Authorities are searching for a 23-year-old man after he slipped into Brisbane River early this morning, failing to resurface.

title.children: Police scouring Brisbane River for man in his 20s

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair

props.synopsis: Wendy Williams tossed a note pleading for help from the window of the assisted care facility where she's been living for three years, reopening a debate about legal guardianships in the US.

title.children: This TV host is under a Britney-style guardianship. She's pleading for help

image.altText: A mugshot style photo of a man in his twenties in a tshirt

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation reveals police may have failed to identify another victim of convicted healthcare killer Garry Davis, who was found guilty of murdering two nursing home residents and attempting to kill a third by injecting them with lethal doses of insulin.

title.children: Retired detective queries police investigation of aged care killer

image.altText: Burned out and dizzy female person with hands covering face. Vector illustration.

props.synopsis: Health anxiety, which is characterised by excessive worrying about illness, is a real condition that can — somewhat ironically — make you sick. But it's also treatable.

title.children: 'It's debilitating': How Dr Google can make you sick

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie, speaking to media.

props.synopsis: Queensland will introduce tougher child protection measures by the end of the year, taking action on the state government's election promise to Daniel Morcombe's parents.

title.children: 'Brave little boy' inspires Queensland crackdown on child safety

image.altText: Robery Dwyer smiling with glasses on and a pink shirt

props.synopsis: The Liberals hold a tight lead against the Nationals in Port Macquarie's state by-election and an election analyst says they're very likely to win.

title.children: Liberals 'likely to win' rare Coalition clash in Port Macquarie by-election

image.altText: An aerial view of a house is destroyed by storm with lots of debris

props.synopsis: A massive storm system moving across the country has triggered deadly dust storms, tornadoes and fanned more than 100 wildfires.

title.children: At least 26 killed by storms and tornadoes in US as extreme weather threatens millions

image.altText: A wing mirror on a car showing a hand on a driving wheel in the reflection.

props.synopsis: Tom takes medicinal cannabis for a bowel condition, but now he is weighing up his options because of a fine he copped for driving with THC in his system.

title.children: Calls for change after driver not at fault in crash charged by police

image.altText: Anthony Albanese stands behind a lectern looking stern.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has reiterated Australia's support for Ukraine after attending a virtual meeting with other world leaders to drum up support for ceasefire discussions.

title.children: Albanese says it's in 'Australia's national interest' to back Ukraine

image.altText: A woman uses virtual reality sticks to navigate an AI situation in virtual reality goggles.

props.synopsis: A training program to help combat a "national crisis" of rising hospital violence puts emergency department workers into situations with virtual aggressive patients.

title.children: Virtual 'code black' pits hospital staff against nightmare patient

image.altText: A small boat heads towards a turbine in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Offshore wind faces community and political opposition as well support for its promise of ample renewable energy and while some claims can be ruled out, experts say other concerns are valid.

title.children: Do offshore turbines kill whales? Wind farm facts, fiction and unknowns

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Back again? I doubt you'll do any better than last week.

title.children: You better believe I’m here to judge you. Let’s play… HARD!

image.altText: Swiatek

props.synopsis: Iga Swiatek loses her cool and smashes a ball back at a ball kid in an ugly incident during the Indian Wells Open semifinal.

title.children: Swiatek booed after ugly incident with ball kid at Indian Wells

image.altText: Starbucks has said it plans to appeal the verdict.

props.synopsis: The negligence lawsuit blamed the man's injuries on Starbucks, saying that an employee didn't wedge the scalding-hot tea firmly enough into a take-out tray.

title.children: US delivery driver wins $79 million in lawsuit over burns from Starbucks tea
